"No pains should be spared to select places for our schools where the moral atmosphere will be as healthful as possible, for the influences 
                                                                           44
that prevail will leave a deep impress on young and forming characters. For this reason a retired locality is best. The great cities, the centers of business and learning, may seem to present some advantages, but these advantages are outweighed by other considerations." --Sp. T. on Ed., p. 43.
